schemeValue.name: AggregateClient
schemeValue.paragraph: Aggregate client account, as defined under ESMA MiFIR.

schemeValue.name: Client
schemeValue.paragraph: The account contains trading activity or positions that belong to a client of the firm that opened the account.

schemeValue.name: House
schemeValue.paragraph: The account contains proprietary trading activity or positions, belonging to the firm that is the owner of the account.

schemeValue.name: Commitment
schemeValue.paragraph: A fee paid by the borrower to keep loan in place until it can be used. For a revolver, the fee paid by a borrower on unused/funded commitments.

schemeValue.name: Facility
schemeValue.paragraph: A fee that is paid on a facility's entire committed amount, regardless of usage; it is often charged on revolving credits to investment grade borrowers instead of a commitment fee because these facilities typically have a competitive-bid option (CBO) that allows a borrower to solicit the best bid from it syndicate group for a given borrowing. The lenders that do not lender until the CBO are still paid for their commitment.

schemeValue.name: Ticking
schemeValue.paragraph: A fee associated with a long-term commitment to provide a Bridge Loan or Credit Facility, which starts accruing the day the Fee Letter is signed (or a specified number of days thereafter) and terminates when the underlying transaction is either consummated or terminated. The Ticking Fee is set forth in the Fee Letter.

schemeValue.name: Utilization
schemeValue.paragraph: Calculated as a percentage of the utilized portion of the facility. This fee type is subject to banding rules - different portions of the utilization amount may be subject to different percentages.

schemeValue.name: CANC
schemeValue.paragraph: Cancelation Report.

schemeValue.name: NEWT
schemeValue.paragraph: New Transaction report.

schemeValue.name: Execution
schemeValue.paragraph: Algorithm responsible for the execution of the transaction.

schemeValue.name: InvestmentDecision
schemeValue.paragraph: Specifies a role of investment decision for the algorithm.

schemeValue.name: PostAllocation
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that the swap has been allocated.

schemeValue.name: PreAllocation
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that the swap is to be allocated.

schemeValue.name: Unallocated
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that the swap has not been allocated.

schemeValue.name: AgentConsent
schemeValue.paragraph: Agent consent to settling the allocation is required.

schemeValue.name: BorrowerConsent
schemeValue.paragraph: Borrower consent to settling the allocation is required.

schemeValue.name: IssuerConsent
schemeValue.paragraph: Issuer (commonly Letter of Credit Issuer) consent to the allocation is required.

schemeValue.name: LenderDueDiligence
schemeValue.paragraph: Due diligence must be completed for the lender in order to settle the allocation.

schemeValue.name: LenderProfileDetails
schemeValue.paragraph: The lender's party profile details are required to settle the allocation.

schemeValue.name: SwingLineLenderConsent
schemeValue.paragraph: The Swing Line Lender's consent to the allocation is required.

schemeValue.name: Agency
schemeValue.paragraph: Agency - Indicates details related to the agent relationship.

schemeValue.name: Brokerage
schemeValue.paragraph: Brokerage - Indicates details related to the broker/dealer relationship.

schemeValue.name: CallBack
schemeValue.paragraph: CallBack - Indicates details related to the team that verifies settlement instructions (i.e. the 'callback' team).

schemeValue.name: Credit
schemeValue.paragraph: Credit - Indicates details for a specific credit (asset), usually a business contact that is involved in structuring the syndicated loan deal or facility.

schemeValue.name: Custody
schemeValue.paragraph: Custody - Indicates details related to the custodian relationship.

schemeValue.name: DistressedLoanClosing
schemeValue.paragraph: DistressedLoanClosing - Indicates details related to specifically the closing of a distressed syndicated loan deal or facility.

schemeValue.name: DistressedLoanServicing
schemeValue.paragraph: DistressedLoanServicing - Indicates details related to specifically the ongoing loan servicing of a distressed syndicated loan deal or facility.

schemeValue.name: DistressedLoanTradeSettlement
schemeValue.paragraph: DistressedLoanTradeSettlement - Indicates details related to specifically the settlement of distressed syndicated loan trades.

schemeValue.name: DistressedLoanTrading
schemeValue.paragraph: DistressedLoanTrading - Indicates details related to specifically the trading of distressed syndicated loan facilities.

schemeValue.name: DueDiligence
schemeValue.paragraph: DueDiligence - Indicates details specifically related to the due diligence process.

schemeValue.name: KnowYourCustomer
schemeValue.paragraph: KnowYourCustomer - Indicates details specifically related to the know-your-customer (i.e. KYC) process.

schemeValue.name: Legal
schemeValue.paragraph: Legal - Indicates legal department details.

schemeValue.name: LetterOfCreditServicing
schemeValue.paragraph: LetterOfCreditServicing - Indicates details related to the ongoing servicing of letters of credit (i.e. L/C team).

schemeValue.name: LoanClosing
schemeValue.paragraph: LoanClosing - Indicates details related to the closing of a syndicated loan deal or facility (i.e. the operations closing team).

schemeValue.name: LoanOrigination
schemeValue.paragraph: LoanOrigination - May be used instead of the 'Credit' code, and is used to more explicitly indicate details related to the origination of a syndicated loan asset.

schemeValue.name: LoanServicing
schemeValue.paragraph: LoanServicing - Indicates details related to the ongoing loan servicing of a syndicated loan deal or facility.

schemeValue.name: LoanTradeSettlement
schemeValue.paragraph: LoanTradeSettlement - Indicates details related to the settlement of syndicated loan trades.

schemeValue.name: LoanTrading
schemeValue.paragraph: LoanTrading - Indicates details related to the trading of syndicated loan facilities.

schemeValue.name: PrimaryLoanTradeSettlement
schemeValue.paragraph: PrimaryLoanTradeSettlement - Indicates details related to specifically the settlement of syndicated loan trades in the primary stage.

schemeValue.name: SecondaryLoanTradeSettlement
schemeValue.paragraph: SecondaryLoanTradeSettlement - Indicates details related to specifically the settlement of syndicated loan trades in the secondary stage.

schemeValue.name: Tax
schemeValue.paragraph: Tax - Indicates tax department details.

schemeValue.name: Trust
schemeValue.paragraph: Trust - Indicates details related to the trustee relationship.

schemeValue.name: AccruingFeePayment
schemeValue.paragraph: AccruingFeePayment - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: AccruingFeePaymentRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: AccruingFeePaymentRetraction - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: Advance
schemeValue.paragraph: Advance - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: AdvanceRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: AdvanceRetraction - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: AllocationPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: AllocationPayment - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: AllocationPaymentRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: AllocationPaymentRetraction - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: InterestPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: InterestPayment - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: InterestPaymentRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: InterestPaymentRetraction - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: NonRecurringFeePayment
schemeValue.paragraph: NonRecurringFeePayment - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: NonRecurringFeePaymentRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: NonRecurringFeePaymentRetraction - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: Repayment
schemeValue.paragraph: Repayment - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: RepaymentRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: RepaymentRetraction - Option reflecting an existing cash event type.

schemeValue.name: TradePayment
schemeValue.paragraph: TradePayment - Option epresents the payment object for all loan trading notifications.

schemeValue.name: TradePaymentRetraction
schemeValue.paragraph: TradePaymentRetraction - Option epresents the payment object for all loan trading notifications.

schemeValue.name: PreClearingCredit
schemeValue.paragraph: An indication that pre-clearing credit has been granted.

schemeValue.name: Commodity
schemeValue.paragraph: Commodity.

schemeValue.name: Credit
schemeValue.paragraph: Credit.

schemeValue.name: Equity
schemeValue.paragraph: Equity.

schemeValue.name: ForeignExchange
schemeValue.paragraph: ForeignExchange.

schemeValue.name: InterestRate
schemeValue.paragraph: InterestRate.

schemeValue.name: AccruedCoupon
schemeValue.paragraph: The coupon accrued on the underlying bonds from that the most recent bond coupon payment date until the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: AccruedInterest
schemeValue.paragraph: The value of interest accrued from the previous payment to the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: AccruedInterestResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The value of interest accrued for price at last Reset.

schemeValue.name: AdditionalPriceNotation
schemeValue.paragraph: The secondary price field as required by CFTC's 17 CFR Part 43.

schemeValue.name: AverageExposure
schemeValue.paragraph: The average exposure of this trade over its lifetime

schemeValue.name: BucketedCreditSpreadSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the credit spread.

schemeValue.name: BucketedDefaultProbabilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the default probability.

schemeValue.name: BucketedInterestRateConvexity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in interest rate sensitivity caused by a single point change in the yield curve (IR Gamma).

schemeValue.name: BucketedInterestRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a single point change in the yield curve (IR Delta).

schemeValue.name: BucketedInterestRateVolatilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the volatility matrix (vega).

schemeValue.name: BucketedRecoveryRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a point change shift in the credit default recovery rate.

schemeValue.name: CalculatedStrike
schemeValue.paragraph: The effective strike price of the option as derived from the underlying asset swap. (Used for options on asset swaps).

schemeValue.name: CAPMBeta
schemeValue.paragraph: Systematic risk = Ratio of expected return to expected return of the market

schemeValue.name: Cash
schemeValue.paragraph: A monetary amount paid or received. For example, a monetary amount payable on the valuation date, or a monetary amount payable on another specified date, such as a payment date.

schemeValue.name: CashEquivalent
schemeValue.paragraph: The CashEquivalentLocalCurrency converted to the reporting currency (e.g. USD) at the spot exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: CashEquivalentLocalCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: The aggregated equivalent FX position in a specific currency. This includes the NPVs payable in that currency, plus equivalent positions generated by trades price sensitivity to FX rates.

schemeValue.name: CleanGrossCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, excluding commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: CleanGrossCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, excluding commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: CleanGrossResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, excluding commissions.

schemeValue.name: CleanNetCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, including commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: CleanNetCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, including commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: CleanNetResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, excluding accrued interest, including commissions.

schemeValue.name: ConvexityAdjustment
schemeValue.paragraph: An adjustment to the price of an instrument (such as a future) to compensate for its lack of convexity.

schemeValue.name: CreditSpread
schemeValue.paragraph: The spread between the return of a credit instrument and of a corresponding risk free instrument.

schemeValue.name: CurrentNotional
schemeValue.paragraph: The notional in effect on the valuation date.

schemeValue.name: DE@R
schemeValue.paragraph: VAR for 1 day time horizon and 95% level of confidence

schemeValue.name: DeltaAdjustedLongSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Delta Adjusted Long Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: DeltaAdjustedShortSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Delta Adjusted Short Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: DeltaFactor
schemeValue.paragraph: The Delta factor.

schemeValue.name: DirtyGrossCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, excluding commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: DirtyGrossCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, excluding commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: DirtyGrossResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, excluding commissions.

schemeValue.name: DirtyNetCurrentMarketPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, including commissions, as observed on a market.

schemeValue.name: DirtyNetCurrentSettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, including commissions, for settlement purposes.

schemeValue.name: DirtyNetResetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The reset price of an asset, expressed in par value, including accrued interest, including commissions.

schemeValue.name: DividendYield
schemeValue.paragraph: The dividend payout ratio, expressed as a decimal (e.g. 0.03 = 3%) per year.

schemeValue.name: EconomicCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: Capital which is kept aside to compensate for unexpected losses due to credit risk. (VAR for 1 year and 99.97%)

schemeValue.name: EquityAccrual
schemeValue.paragraph: Unrealized profit or loss on an equity price based stream or product. This is based on the difference between current market price and the reset/reference price.

schemeValue.name: EVA
schemeValue.paragraph: Economic Value Added = (Spread + Fees - Expected loss - Operating cost) -ROE*(Capital at risk)

schemeValue.name: FixedPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: A numerical price (usually a stock or bond price or a commodity price) that is used to price a derivative.

schemeValue.name: FixedRate
schemeValue.paragraph: A numerical rate (usually an interest or FX rate) that is used to price a derivative.

schemeValue.name: FundingOnRealizedGains
schemeValue.paragraph: Funding-related interest charges associated with profit or loss on realized gains that have not yet been exchanged.

schemeValue.name: FXSpotSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a change in FX spot rate

schemeValue.name: GrossNotional
schemeValue.paragraph: The gross notional.

schemeValue.name: GrossNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: The gross NPV.

schemeValue.name: ImpliedVolatility
schemeValue.paragraph: The implied volatility of the underlying asset from the valuation date to the expiration of the option.

schemeValue.name: InterestOnRealizedGains
schemeValue.paragraph: Accrued interest on realized gains, for portfolio swap agreements where unwind profit/loss not exchanged until reset.

schemeValue.name: JensensAlpha
schemeValue.paragraph: The average excess return on a portfolio relative to the excess return predicted by CAPM

schemeValue.name: LoanEquivalent
schemeValue.paragraph: The loan equivalent exposure of this asset.

schemeValue.name: LongNotionalPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Long Notional Position.

schemeValue.name: LongSwapPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Long Swap Position.

schemeValue.name: MarginalRisk
schemeValue.paragraph: Change of a portfolio VAR with addition of a specified asset.

schemeValue.name: MarketQuote
schemeValue.paragraph: The price of an instrument as quoted on an exchange or similar market.

schemeValue.name: ModifiedSharpeRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: Sharpe ratio where both return and risk are defined relative to a benchmark portfolio

schemeValue.name: NonDeltaAdjustedLongSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Non Delta Adjusted Long Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: NonDeltaAdjustedShortSwaptionPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Non Delta Adjusted Short Swaption Position.

schemeValue.name: NPV
schemeValue.paragraph: Net Present Value = sum of present values of all cash flows; excludes cash flows paid or received on the valution date.

schemeValue.name: NPVLocalCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: NPV in the trade currency.

schemeValue.name: NumberOfUnderlyingSecurities
schemeValue.paragraph: Used for bond positions to report the product of the open units and the par value of the bond.

schemeValue.name: PAI
schemeValue.paragraph: Price adjustment interest ... the amount of interest owing on the NPV over the previous calculation period (use in clearing models).

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftCreditSpreadSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the credit spread.

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftDefaultProbabilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the default probability.

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftInterestRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the yield curve/risk free rate of interest (IR Delta, rho).

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftInterestRateVolatilitySensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the volatility matrix (vega).

schemeValue.name: ParallelShiftRecoveryRateSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a parallel shift in the credit default recovery rate.

schemeValue.name: PayNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: NPV of cash flows for which the base counterparty pays.

schemeValue.name: PeakExposure
schemeValue.paragraph: The peak/potential exposure of this trade over its lifetime

schemeValue.name: Premium
schemeValue.paragraph: A fee paid or received to purchase a contract (usually an option).

schemeValue.name: PriceNotation
schemeValue.paragraph: The primary price field as required by CFTC's 17 CFR Part 43.

schemeValue.name: PriorNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: Net Present Value for prior day/processing run = sum of present values of all cash flows; excludes cash flows paid or received on the valution date.

schemeValue.name: RAROC
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk adjusted return on capital = (Adjusted income)/(Capital at risk)

schemeValue.name: RealizedTradingGains
schemeValue.paragraph: Realized profit or loss that has not yet been exchanged. This is based on positions that have been closed out but not settled.

schemeValue.name: RealizedVariance
schemeValue.paragraph: Realized variance between effective date and valuation date.

schemeValue.name: ReceiveNPV
schemeValue.paragraph: NPV of cash flows for which the base counterparty receives.

schemeValue.name: RecoveryRate
schemeValue.paragraph: The estimated amount that a creditor would receive in final satisfaction of the claims on a defaulted credit.

schemeValue.name: RegulatoryCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: A provision for expected losses, required by the BIS.

schemeValue.name: ReturnOnEconomicCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: The return from an asset expressed as a percentage of the amount of economic capital involved in holding that asset.

schemeValue.name: ReturnOnRegulatoryCapital
schemeValue.paragraph: The return from an asset expressed as a percentage of the amount of regulatory capital involved in holding that asset.

schemeValue.name: RiskConcentration
schemeValue.paragraph: Measures the amount of risk concentrated in individual counterparties, similar assets, common geographical locations, or common industries.

schemeValue.name: ROA
schemeValue.paragraph: Return on assets = (Adjusted income)/Assets

schemeValue.name: RORAC
schemeValue.paragraph: Return on risk-adjusted capital = (Adjusted income)/(BIS risk - based capital requirement)

schemeValue.name: SettlementFxRate
schemeValue.paragraph: The FX rate used to compute a settlement amount.

schemeValue.name: SettlementPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The settlement price.

schemeValue.name: SharpeRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: The ratio between portfolio return in excess of the risk-free return and portfolio risk (measured as volatility)

schemeValue.name: ShortNotionalPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Short Notional Position.

schemeValue.name: ShortSwapPosition
schemeValue.paragraph: The Short Swap Position.

schemeValue.name: SortinoRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar to Sharpe Ratio but risk defined as downside risk rather than portfolio variance.

schemeValue.name: StrikePrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The strike price.

schemeValue.name: TransactedGrossPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The price, exclusive of any commission, at which a transaction has been conducted.

schemeValue.name: TransactedNetPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: The actual price (inclusive of commissions, when applicable) at which a transaction has been conducted.

schemeValue.name: TreatedRate
schemeValue.paragraph: A rate following rate treatment procedures.

schemeValue.name: TreynorRatio
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar to Sharpe Ratio but risk defined as CAPM systematic risk (beta) rather than portfolio variance.

schemeValue.name: ValuationDateChangeSensitivity
schemeValue.paragraph: Change in NPV/value caused by a change in valuation date (theta).

schemeValue.name: VAR
schemeValue.paragraph: Value at Risk is the amount of money that could be lost over a pre-defined period of time with a a given level of confidence.

schemeValue.name: VariationMargin
schemeValue.paragraph: Amount required to be posted to accommodate change in net value of trade or portfolio.

schemeValue.name: Volatility
schemeValue.paragraph: The underlying price volatility used for calculating the value of this asset.

schemeValue.name: HalfFeePerMasterTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Half of the assignment fee, as set forth in the credit agreement, is charged for the entire trade regardless of the number of facilities included in the trade and regardless of the number of sub-allocations made.

schemeValue.name: OneFeePerAssignment
schemeValue.paragraph: One full assignment fee, as fee set forth in the credit agreement, is charged for each separate allocation/assignment agreement under the master trade.

schemeValue.name: OneFeePerMasterTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: One full assignment fee, as fee set forth in the credit agreement, is charged for the entire trade regardless of the number of facilities included in the trade and regardless of the number of sub-allocations made.

schemeValue.name: Waived
schemeValue.paragraph: The assignment fee is waived for the entire trade.

schemeValue.name: ABX
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type representing ABX index trades.

schemeValue.name: AsiaCorporate
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type of Asia Corporate.

schemeValue.name: AsiaSovereign
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type of Asia Sovereign.

schemeValue.name: DJ.CDX.NA

schemeValue.name: EmergingEuropeanAndMiddleEasternSovereign
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type of Emerging European and Middle Eastern Sovereign.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for EMERGING EUROPEAN CORPORATE.

schemeValue.name: EmergingEuropeanCorporateLPN
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for EMERGING EUROPEAN CORPORATE LPN.

schemeValue.name: EuropeanCMBS
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for Single Name European CMBS Transactions.

schemeValue.name: EuropeanCorporate
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type of European Corporate.

schemeValue.name: EuropeanRMBS
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for Single Name European RMBS Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Asia Excluding Japan.

schemeValue.name: iTraxxAsiaExJapanSwaption
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Asia Ex-Japan Swaption Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Asia Excluding Japan Tranched Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Australia.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Australia Swaption Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Australia Tranched Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx CJ.

schemeValue.name: iTraxxCJTranche
schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx CJ Tranched Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Europe.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Europe Transactions

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Europe Swaption Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Europe Tranched Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Japan.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx Japan Swaption Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx LevX.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx SDI 75 Transactions.

schemeValue.paragraph: Broker Confirmation Type for iTraxx SovX.

schemeValue.name: Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for splitting a trade across accounts.

schemeValue.name: Clearing
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for novating a trade to a central counterparty (with margining) for credit risk mitigation.

schemeValue.name: Confirmation
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for verifying the terms of a trade.

schemeValue.name: Execution
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for executing a trade.

schemeValue.name: Reconciliation
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for comparing representations of a trade or portfolio for the purpose of identifying and resolving discrepancies.

schemeValue.name: Settlement
schemeValue.paragraph: Process for calculating payment amounts and performing payments as required by the terms of a transaction.

schemeValue.name: AmendmentFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with an amendment lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: AssignmentFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow resulting from the assignment of a contract to a new counterparty.

schemeValue.name: Coupon
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the periodic accrued interests.

schemeValue.name: CreditEvent
schemeValue.paragraph: A cashflow resulting from a credit event.

schemeValue.name: DividendReturn
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the synthetic dividend of an equity underlyer asset traded through a derivative instrument.

schemeValue.name: ExerciseFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with an exercise lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: Fee
schemeValue.paragraph: A generic term for describing a non-scheduled cashflow that can be associated either with the initial contract, with some later corrections to it (e.g. a correction to the day count fraction that has a cashflow impact) or with some lifecycle events. Fees that are specifically associated with termination and partial termination, increase, amendment, and exercise events are qualified accordingly.

schemeValue.name: IncreaseFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with an increase lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: InterestReturn
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the return of the interest rate portion of a derivative instrument that has different types of underlying assets, such as a total return swap.

schemeValue.name: PartialTerminationFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with a partial termination lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: Premium
schemeValue.paragraph: The premium associated with an OTC contract such as an option or a cap/floor.

schemeValue.name: PriceReturn
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow corresponding to the return of the price portion of a derivative instrument that has different types of underlying assets, such as a total return swap.

schemeValue.name: PrincipalExchange
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow which amount typically corresponds to the notional of the contract and that is exchanged between the parties on trade inception and reverted back when the contract is terminated.

schemeValue.name: TerminationFee
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash flow associated with a termination lifecycle event.

schemeValue.name: Agent
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of the sender of the report, typically a clearing member firm or dealer (acting as an agent).

schemeValue.name: Counterparty
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of the counterparty of the sender of the report, which is typically a clearing member firm or dealer.

schemeValue.name: Customer
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of a client opposite the sender of the report, which is typically a clearing member firm or dealer.

schemeValue.name: Principal
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade or trade report represents the information from the perspective of the sender of the report, typically a clearing member firm or dealer (acting as a principal).

schemeValue.name: Clearstream
schemeValue.paragraph: Clearstream International

schemeValue.name: CREST
schemeValue.paragraph: CREST

schemeValue.name: DTCC
schemeValue.paragraph: The Depository Trust and Clearing Corporation

schemeValue.name: Euroclear
schemeValue.paragraph: Euroclear

schemeValue.name: MonteTitoli
schemeValue.paragraph: Monte Titoli SPA

schemeValue.name: Agent-Affiliate
schemeValue.paragraph: Used to indicate a clearing exception where a firm is hedging and using an agent to do doing the hedging on its behalf.

schemeValue.name: Cooperative
schemeValue.paragraph: Clearing exception for certain swaps entered into by cooperatives. In the US, see Regulation 50.51(a) Definition of Exempt Cooperative.

schemeValue.name: End-User
schemeValue.paragraph: In the US, see CFTC Final Rule on End-User Exception to Clearing Requirements for Swaps Fact Sheet.

schemeValue.name: Exception
schemeValue.paragraph: Used to indicate an exception to a clearing requirement without elaborating on the type of exception.

schemeValue.name: Inter-Affiliate
schemeValue.paragraph: In the US, see CFTC Final Rule - Clearing Exemption for Swaps Between Certain Affiliated Entities.

schemeValue.name: Treasury-Affiliate
schemeValue.paragraph: In the US, see CFTC No Action Letter 13-22 No Action Relief from the Clearing Requirement for Swaps Entered into by Eligible Treasury Affiliates.

schemeValue.name: Accepted
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has passed CCP eligibility checks and is accepted as a request for clearing.

schemeValue.name: AwaitingAcceptance
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is awaiting approval by a clearing firm/broker before a registration can be confirmed.

schemeValue.name: Cancelled
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has been cancelled.

schemeValue.name: Decleared
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has been rescinded from clearing with the CCP.

schemeValue.name: Exercised
schemeValue.paragraph: The option trade has been exercised (applicable where the CCP is the option executor).

schemeValue.name: Expired
schemeValue.paragraph: The option trade has been expired (applicable where the CCP is the option executor).

schemeValue.name: Pending
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is pending an internal CCP process before registration can be confirmed.

schemeValue.name: PendingTheirApproval
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is awaiting approval by the other clearing firm/broker before a registration can be confirmed.

schemeValue.name: Received
schemeValue.paragraph: The request for a trade to be cleared has been received by the CCP.

schemeValue.name: Registered
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is registered with the CCP and novation has taken place.

schemeValue.name: Rejected
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has failed CCP eligibility checks and is rejected as a request for clearing.

schemeValue.name: Settled
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has been settled (applicable where the CCP initiates settlement).

schemeValue.name: Uncleared
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade has not been cleared and there is no pending clearing operation on it.

schemeValue.name: Fully
schemeValue.paragraph: Both initial margin (independent amount) and variation margin will be posted. For Transparency view, both parties will do this; for Recordkeeping view, this party will do this (a separate indicator in the other partyTradeInformation block is used for the other side).

schemeValue.name: OneWay
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Transparency view only. One party will post some form of collateral (initial margin or variation margin.)

schemeValue.name: Partially
schemeValue.paragraph: Variation margin (but not initial margin) will be posted. For Transparency view, both parties will do this; for Recordkeeping view, this party will do this (a separate indicator in the other partyTradeInformation block is used for the other side).

schemeValue.name: Uncollateralized
schemeValue.paragraph: No collateral is posted for this trade. In Transparency view, no collateral is posted by either party; in Recordkeeping view, no collateral is posted by the counterparty.

schemeValue.name: NominationDeadline
schemeValue.paragraph: The date by which nomination must be received for a given Delivery Period.

schemeValue.name: All
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed on all days (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: First
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed only on the first day (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: Last
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed only on the last day (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: Penultimate
schemeValue.paragraph: The price will be observed only on the penultimate day (day type is defined in the message) in the Calculation Period.

schemeValue.name: AverageAtPeriodEnd
schemeValue.paragraph: An average FX rate will be applied to the Floating Amount when this is calculated.

schemeValue.name: Daily
schemeValue.paragraph: The prevailing FX spot rate will be applied to the observed Commodity Reference Price on each Pricing Date.

schemeValue.name: SpotAtPeriodEnd
schemeValue.paragraph: The prevailing FX spot rate will be applied to the Floating Amount when this is calculated.

schemeValue.name: AverageDailyPriceDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Average Daily Price Disruption as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: CalculationAgentDetermination
schemeValue.paragraph: Calculation Agent Determination as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: DelayedPublicationOrAnnouncement
schemeValue.paragraph: Delayed Publication or Announcement as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (vii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: FallbackReferenceDealers
schemeValue.paragraph: Fallback Reference Dealers as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: FallbackReferencePrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Fallback Reference Price as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: NegotiatedFallback
schemeValue.paragraph: Negotiated Fallback as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (ii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: NoFaultTermination
schemeValue.paragraph: No Fault Termination as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: Postponement
schemeValue.paragraph: Postponement as defined in section 7.5 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.5 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: DeMinimisTrading
schemeValue.paragraph: De Minimis Trading as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions.

schemeValue.name: DisappearanceOfCommodityReferencePrice
schemeValue.paragraph: Disappearance of Commodity Reference Price as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: MaterialChangeInContent
schemeValue.paragraph: Material Change in Content as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (v) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: MaterialChangeInFormula
schemeValue.paragraph: Material Change in Formula as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (iv) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: PriceSourceDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Price Source Disruption as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (i) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: TaxDisruption
schemeValue.paragraph: Tax Disruption as defined in section 7.4 para (c) subpara (vi) of the ISDA 2005 Commodity Derivative definitions or section 7.4 para (c) subpara (vii) of the ISDA 1993 Commodity Derivative definitions as applicable.

schemeValue.name: TradingLimitation

schemeValue.name: TradingSuspension

schemeValue.name: BillOfLading
schemeValue.paragraph: The date on which a Bill of Lading is issued.

schemeValue.name: CompletionOfDischarge
schemeValue.paragraph: The date on which Completion of Discharge occurs.

schemeValue.name: NoticeOfReadiness
schemeValue.paragraph: The date on which a Notice of Readiness is issued.

schemeValue.name: PerBusinessDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Commodity Business Day for purposes of calculating the Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerCalculationPeriod
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Calculation Period for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerCalendarDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Calendar Day for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerHour
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per hour for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerMonth
schemeValue.paragraph: The Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Month for purposes of calculating the Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: PerSettlementPeriod
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once per Settlement Period for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: Term
schemeValue.paragraph: The Quantity or Notional Quantity is deemed to apply once over the term of the trade for purposes of calculating the Total Quantity or Total Notional Quantity.

schemeValue.name: Annual
schemeValue.paragraph: The curve represents annual compounding.

schemeValue.name: Continuous
schemeValue.paragraph: The curve represents continuous compounding.

schemeValue.name: Daily
schemeValue.paragraph: The curve represents daily compounding.

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar trades were combined into a single net trade.

schemeValue.name: PortfolioCompression
schemeValue.paragraph: A large pool of trades was combined into a small number of trades with a similar risk position.

schemeValue.name: Electronic
schemeValue.paragraph: Confirmation via a shared confirmation facility or platform, or a private/bilateral electronic system.

schemeValue.name: NonElectronic
schemeValue.paragraph: Confirmation via a human-readable written document (possibly transmitted electronically).

schemeValue.name: NotConfirmed
schemeValue.paragraph: This trade has not been confirmed and is not expected to be confirmed in any form. For example, this could include situations where the trade is an inter-affiliate trade and no confirmation is required, or cases were confirmation is negative only. For trades that have not yet been confirmed but are expected to be confirmed, one of the other values should be used.

schemeValue.name: Bankruptcy
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by bankruptcy. A legal proceeding involving a person or business that is unable to repay outstanding debts. The bankruptcy process begins with a petition filed by the debtor (most common) or on behalf of creditors (less common). All of the debtor's assets are measured and evaluated, whereupon the assets are used to repay a portion of outstanding debt. Upon the successful completion of bankruptcy proceedings, the debtor is relieved of the debt obligations incurred prior to filing for bankruptcy. The value maps closely to the ISO code (BRUP) defined as the legal status of a company unable to pay creditors. Bankruptcy usually involves a formal court ruling. Securities may become valueless.

schemeValue.name: BonusIssue
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a bonus issue. A bonus issue or bonus share is a free share of stock given to current shareholders in a company, based upon the number of shares that the shareholder already owns. While the issue of bonus shares increases the total number of shares issued and owned, it does not change the value of the company. The value maps closely to the ISO code (BONU) defined as a bonus, scrip or capitalisation issue. Security holders receive additional assets free of payment from the issuer, in proportion to their holding.

schemeValue.name: ClassAction
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a Class Action. An action where an individual represents a group in a court claim. The judgment from the suit is for all the members of the group (class). The value maps closely to the ISO code (CLSA) defined as the situation where interested parties seek restitution for financial loss. The security holder may be offered the opportunity to join a class action proceeding and would need to respond with an instruction.

schemeValue.name: CreditEvent
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a credit event. A credit event is any sudden and tangible (negative) change in a borrower's credit standing or decline in credit rating. A credit event brings into question the borrower's ability to repay its debt. It is the defining trigger in a credit derivative contract, or credit default swap. If the borrower experiences a credit event, then the buyer of the contract must pay the seller an agreed-upon sum to cover the loss. The value maps closely to the ISO code (CREV) defined as an occurrence of credit derivative for which the issuer of one or several underlying securities is unable to fulfill his financial obligations (as defined in terms and conditions).

schemeValue.name: Default
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a default. The failure to promptly pay interest or principal when due. Default occurs when a debtor is unable to meet the legal obligation of debt repayment. Borrowers may default when they are unable to make the required payment or are unwilling to honor the debt. The value maps closely to the ISO code (DFLT) defined as the failure by the company to perform obligations defined as default events under the bond agreement and that have not been remedied.

schemeValue.name: EarlyRedemption
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by an early redemption. The value maps closely to the ISO code (MCAL) defined as the redemption of an entire issue outstanding of securities, for example, bonds, preferred equity, funds, by the issuer or its agent, for example, asset manager, before final maturity.

schemeValue.name: EquityRights
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by Equity Rights.

schemeValue.name: Liquidation
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a liquidation. When a business or firm is terminated or bankrupt, its assets are sold (liquidated) and the proceeds pay creditors. Any leftovers are distributed to shareholders. The value maps closely to the ISO code (LIQU) defined as a distribution of cash, assets or both. Debt may be paid in order of priority based on preferred claims to assets specified by the security.

schemeValue.name: Merger
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a merger. Mergers and acquisitions (abbreviated M&A) is an aspect of corporate strategy, corporate finance and management dealing with the buying, selling, dividing and combining of different companies and similar entities that can help an enterprise grow rapidly in its sector or location of origin, or a new field or new location, without creating a subsidiary, other child entity or using a joint venture. The distinction between a "merger" and an "acquisition" has become increasingly blurred in various respects (particularly in terms of the ultimate economic outcome), although it has not completely disappeared in all situations. The value maps closely to the ISO code (MRGR) defined as an offer made to shareholders, normally by a third party, requesting them to sell (tender) or exchange their equities.

schemeValue.name: ReverseSplit
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a reverse split. A reverse stock split or reverse split is a process by a company of issuing to each shareholder in that company a smaller number of new shares in proportion to that shareholder's original shares that are subsequently canceled. A reverse stock split is also called a stock merge. The reduction in the number of issued shares is accompanied by a proportional increase in the share price. The value maps closely to the ISO code (SPLR) defined as a decrease in a company's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are increased accordingly.

schemeValue.name: SpinOff
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a spin Off. A spin-out, also known as a spin-off or a starburst, refers to a type of corporate action where a company "splits off" sections of itself as a separate business. The value maps closely to the ISO code (SOFF) defined as a a distribution of subsidiary stock to the shareholders of the parent company without a surrender of shares. Spin-off represents a form of divestiture usually resulting in an independent company or in an existing company. For example, demerger, distribution, unbundling.

schemeValue.name: StockReclassification
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a Stock Reclassification.

schemeValue.name: StockSplit
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a stock split. A stock split or stock divide increases the number of shares in a public company. The price is adjusted such that the before and after market capitalization of the company remains the same and dilutiondoes not occur. The value maps closely to the ISO code (SPLF) defined as a distribution of subsidiary stock to the shareholders of the parent company without a surrender of shares. Spin-off represents a form of divestiture usually resulting in an independent company or in an existing company. For example, demerger, distribution, unbundling.

schemeValue.name: Takeover
schemeValue.paragraph: Corporate action triggered by a takeover. A takeover is the purchase of onecompany (the target) by another (the acquirer, or bidder). The value maps to the ISO code (TEND) but is finer grained than TEND which emcompasses Tender/Acquisition/Takeover/Purchase Offer/Buyback. ISO defines the TEND code as an offer made to shareholders, normally by a third party, requesting them to sell (tender) or exchange their equities.

Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (a) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (a).

schemeValue.name: 30E/360
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (g) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (f). Note that the algorithm defined for this day count fraction has changed between the 2000 ISDA Definitions and 2006 ISDA Definitions. See Introduction to the 2006 ISDA Definitions for further information relating to this change.

schemeValue.name: 30E/360.ISDA
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (h). Note the algorithm for this day count fraction under the 2006 ISDA Definitions is designed to yield the same results in practice as the version of the 30E/360 day count fraction defined in the 2000 ISDA Definitions. See Introduction to the 2006 ISDA Definitions for further information relating to this change.

schemeValue.name: ACT/360
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (e) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (d).

schemeValue.name: ACT/365.FIXED
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (d) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (c).

schemeValue.name: ACT/365L
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (i).

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.AFB
schemeValue.paragraph: The Fixed/Floating Amount will be calculated in accordance with the "BASE EXACT/EXACT" day count fraction, as defined in the "Definitions Communes plusieurs Additifs Techniques" published by the Association Francaise des Banques in September 1994.

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.ICMA
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (c). This day count fraction code is applicable for transactions booked under the 2006 ISDA Definitions. Transactions under the 2000 ISDA Definitions should use the ACT/ACT.ISMA code instead.

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.ISDA
schemeValue.paragraph: Per 2006 ISDA Definitions, Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (b) or Annex to the 2000 ISDA Definitions (June 2000 Version), Section 4.16. Day Count Fraction, paragraph (b). Note that going from FpML 2.0 Recommendation to the FpML 3.0 Trial Recommendation the code in FpML 2.0 'ACT/365.ISDA' became 'ACT/ACT.ISDA'.

schemeValue.name: ACT/ACT.ISMA
schemeValue.paragraph: The Fixed/Floating Amount will be calculated in accordance with Rule 251 of the statutes, by-laws, rules and recommendations of the International Securities Market Association, as published in April 1999, as applied to straight and convertible bonds issued after December 31, 1998, as though the Fixed/Floating Amount were the interest coupon on such a bond. This day count fraction code is applicable for transactions booked under the 2000 ISDA Definitions. Transactions under the 2006 ISDA Definitions should use the ACT/ACT.ICMA code instead.

schemeValue.name: BUS/252
schemeValue.paragraph: The number of Business Days in the Calculation Period or Compounding Period in respect of which payment is being made divided by 252.

schemeValue.name: ClearedInError
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade was cleared in error (but the trade itself remains in effect).

schemeValue.name: RemovedFromClearing
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade will no longer be cleared. For example, the trade was amended and is no longer eligible for clearing, the clearing service no longer clears this type of trade, etc.

schemeValue.name: TradeCancelled
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade was cancelled, e.g. due to an error in creation of the trade.

schemeValue.name: TransferredClearingService
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade was relocated to a new clearing service.

schemeValue.name: DeliveryVersusPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that a securities delivery must be made against payment in simultaneous transmissions and stipulate each other.

schemeValue.name: FreeOfPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that a securities delivery can be made without a simultaneous cash payment in exchange and not depending on if payment obligations are fulfilled or not and vice versa.

schemeValue.name: PreDelivery
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that a securities delivery must be made in full before the payment for the securities; fulfillment of payment obligations depends on securities delivery obligations fulfillment.

schemeValue.name: PrePayment
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that a payment in full amount must be made before the securities delivery; fulfillment of securities delivery obligations depends on payment obligations fulfillment.

schemeValue.name: CFR

schemeValue.name: CIF

schemeValue.name: CIP

schemeValue.name: CPT

schemeValue.name: DAF

schemeValue.name: Analytic
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed analytically, e.g. by a closed form analytical equation.

schemeValue.name: Numerical
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed by other (non-perturbative) numerical means, such as a direct output from a numerical model.

schemeValue.name: Perturbation
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed by a numerical difference method, ie. by numerically perturbing the input, recalculating the measure, and dividing by the amount of the perturbation.

schemeValue.name: Substitution
schemeValue.paragraph: The derivative is computed by finite difference based on the substitution of a supplied pricing input, e.g. a bumped yield curve.

schemeValue.name: OptionalEarlyTerminationProvision

schemeValue.paragraph: Overnight Index Swap (OIS) 'multi-currency swaps' or ‘cross-currency swaps’ and futures/forwards on Overnight Index Swap (OIS) 'multi-currency swaps' or ‘cross-currency swaps’

schemeValue.name: InterestRate:OIS:SingleCurrency
schemeValue.paragraph: Overnight Index Swap (OIS) 'single currency swaps' and futures/forwards on Overnight Index Swap (OIS) 'single currency swaps'

schemeValue.name: InterestRate:Option
schemeValue.paragraph: IR options

schemeValue.name: InterestRate:Other
schemeValue.paragraph: Other Interest Rate Derivatives

schemeValue.name: InterestRate:Swaption
schemeValue.paragraph: Swaptions

schemeValue.name: Alleged
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding payment (or set of payments) was found in "your" submitted sets.

schemeValue.name: Cancelled
schemeValue.paragraph: One or the other side's values were cancelled.

schemeValue.name: Matched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same payment (or set of payments) information within matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Mismatched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same payment (or set of payments), but there are differences greater than the acceptable tolerance in the matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Unmatched
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding payment (or set of payments) was found in the "other party's" submitted sets.

schemeValue.name: Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade results from an allocation.

schemeValue.name: Allocation:Full
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade through an allocation operation, as the entire size of the trade is allocated. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Allocation:Partial
schemeValue.paragraph: The reduction in size of a trade caused by an allocaiton operation, as only part of the size of the trade is allocated. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Amendment
schemeValue.paragraph: A negotiated change to the terms of a trade. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: BasketChange
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade was affected by a change to the composition of a basket that underlay it.

schemeValue.name: Cancel:BarrierStrike
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade that was cancelled because an observed rate or price crossed a pre-determined barrier (knock-out). (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Cancel:Error
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade that was raised in error. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Cancel:Legal
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade that cancelled for legal reasons (e.g prohibited by law or regulation). (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Cancel:Rebooking
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade because it was replaced by a corrected trade (via an Inception:Rebooking event). (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Cancel:Withdrawal
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade that withdrawn from reporting from the reporting service. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Clear
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade because it was cleared via a central counterparty clearing house. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Cleared
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade is the result of a clearing operation. Applies in the context of an alpha trade.

schemeValue.name: Clearing
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade is the result of a clearing operation. Applies in the context of a beta or gamma trade.

schemeValue.name: Compression
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade because it was replaced in a portfolio compression operation (via an Inception:Compression event). (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: CorporateAction
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade experienced a corporate action (e.g., strategic restructuring, renaming, merger, acquisition).

schemeValue.name: Exercise
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade results from an exercise event or experienced an exercise.

schemeValue.name: Exercise:Full
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade because it was a fully exercised option (possibly via an Inception:Exercise event if physically settled). (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Exercise:Partial
schemeValue.paragraph: The reduction in size of a trade because it is an option that was partially exercised (possibly via an Inception:Exercise event if physically settled). (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Expiration
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the option in the trade expired worthless.

schemeValue.name: Expiry
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade because it was an option that expired without being exercised. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Inception:Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade as an allocation of another trade. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Inception:Clear
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade through a clearing operation. (This trade will have a central counterparty clearinghouse as one counterparty). (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Inception:Compression
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade through a portfolio compression operation. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Inception:Exercise
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade through an exercise of a physically settled option. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Inception:NewTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade through a new, standalone trade. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Inception:Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade through the novation of another trade, in which the counterparty iss assigned to another party. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Inception:Rebooking
schemeValue.paragraph: The creation of a trade because of the cancellation and rebooking of another trade. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Increase
schemeValue.paragraph: The negotiated modification of a trade in which it size (notional, number of option, volume, etc.) is increased. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: IndexChange
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade was affected by an external change to a published index.

schemeValue.name: Maturity
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade because all of its terms have been satisfied due to the passage of time. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Modification:BarrierStrike
schemeValue.paragraph: A change in terms of the trade because an observed rate or price crossed a predetermined barrier (e.g. knock-in, partial knock-out, etc.) (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:BasketChange
schemeValue.paragraph: A change in terms of the trade caused by a change to the composition of a basket that underlay it. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:CorporateAction
schemeValue.paragraph: A change in terms of the trade caused by a corporate action (e.g. merger, acquisition, name change, strategic restructuring). (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:CreditEvent
schemeValue.paragraph: A reduction in the size of a trade caused by a credit event experienced by an underlying reference entity. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:IndexChange
schemeValue.paragraph: A change in terms of the trade caused by a change to an index (renaming, discontinuation, etc.). (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:Legal
schemeValue.paragraph: A change in the terms of the trade caused by a legally mandated change (e.g. act of government). (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:Other
schemeValue.paragraph: A non-negotiated change to the terms of the trade caused by unspecified reasons. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Modification:Reset
schemeValue.paragraph: A change in the terms of the trade, such as its notional, caused by a resetting event, generally the observation of a rate or price. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade was novated (transferred fully or in part to another counterparty).

schemeValue.name: Novation:Full
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade through a novation operation, in which the counterparty is assigned to another party. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Novation:Full:StepOut
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade through a novation operation, in which the risk-taking party must change legal entities due to reassignment of the counterparty. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Novation:Partial
schemeValue.paragraph: The reduction in size of a trade caused by a novation operation, in which which some of the size of the trade is assigned to another counterparty. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Regulatory:Change
schemeValue.paragraph: The resubmission of a trade because its regulatory reportability has changed (e.g. now reportable to another regulator, or no longer reportable to a certain regulator). This event is not considered a trade lifecycle event. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Reset
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade's terms, such as notional, were changed by a resetting event (for example an equity swap reset, or an fx-linked notional swap reset).

schemeValue.name: Termination:Full
schemeValue.paragraph: The elimination of a trade caused by a negotiated agreement between the two parties, generally involving a payment from one party to the other. (End of Life = Yes).

schemeValue.name: Termination:Partial
schemeValue.paragraph: The reduction in size (notional, number of options, volume, etc.) of a trade caused by a negotiated agreement between the two parties, generally involving a payment from one party to the other. (End of Life = No).

schemeValue.name: Trade
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade or trade package is the result of a new trading activity.

schemeValue.name: Valuation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade is being reported to update its valuation.

schemeValue.name: Withdrawal
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade was withdrawn from the reporting service.

schemeValue.name: T
schemeValue.paragraph: The Transferee will be obliged to transfer to the Transferor IA Equivalent Credit Support in respect of the Original Credit Support no later than the date on which the Transferee receives the New Credit Support (the "Exchange Date").

schemeValue.name: T+2
schemeValue.paragraph: The Transferee will be obliged to transfer to the Transferor IA Equivalent Credit Support in respect of the Original Credit Support no later than Two Settlement Days following the date on which the Transferee receives the New Credit Support (the "Exchange Date").

schemeValue.name: T+3
schemeValue.paragraph: The Transferee will be obliged to transfer to the Transferor IA Equivalent Credit Support in respect of the Original Credit Support no later than Three Settlement Days following the date on which the Transferee receives the New Credit Support (the "Exchange Date").

schemeValue.name: T+4
schemeValue.paragraph: The Transferee will be obliged to transfer to the Transferor IA Equivalent Credit Support in respect of the Original Credit Support no later than four Settlement Days following the date on which the Transferee receives the New Credit Support (the "Exchange Date").

schemeValue.name: Electronic
schemeValue.paragraph: Execution via electronic execution facility, derivatives contract market, or other electronic message such as an instant message.

schemeValue.name: Voice
schemeValue.paragraph: Execution via a spoken agreement, for example over a telephone call.

schemeValue.name: Written
schemeValue.paragraph: Execution via a written document.

schemeValue.name: DCM
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered Designated Contract Market.

schemeValue.name: ETP
schemeValue.paragraph: Electronic Trading Platform as defined in the Japanese Financial Instruments and Exchange Act.

schemeValue.name: MTF
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered Multilateral Trading Facility (MiFID and MiFID II) - Pursuant to MiFID II, refers to a multilateral system operated by an investment firm or market operator, which brings together multiple third-party buying and selling interests in financial instruments in the system, in accordance with non-discretionary rules, in a way that results in a contract in accordance with the provisions of Title II of the MiFID II.

schemeValue.name: OffFacility
schemeValue.paragraph: Bilateral execution between counterparties not pursuant to the rules of a SEF or DCM.

schemeValue.name: OTF
schemeValue.paragraph: Organised Trading Facility (MiFID II). A multilateral system which is not a regulated market or MTF and in which multiple third party buying and selling interests in bonds, structured finance product, emissions allowances or derivatives are able to interact in the system in a way which results in a contract.

schemeValue.name: SEF
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered Swaps Execution Facility.

schemeValue.name: American
schemeValue.paragraph: Option can be exercised on any date between a commencement date and an expiration date.

schemeValue.name: Bermuda
schemeValue.paragraph: Option can be exercised on a specific set of exercise dates.

schemeValue.name: European
schemeValue.paragraph: Option can be exercised once on a specified expiration date.

schemeValue.name: IndexOrBasket
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk that is a component of an overall index or multi-commodity/multi-asset basket.

schemeValue.name: Other
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk with no special or mitigating characteristics.

schemeValue.name: TwoComponentIntercommoditySpread
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk generated by a trade based on a spread between two commodities.

schemeValue.name: TwoComponentLocationalBasis
schemeValue.paragraph: Risk generated by a trade based on a basis between a single commodity at different delivery locations.

schemeValue.name: ABL
schemeValue.paragraph: Asset -Based Loan (ABL): a loan that is secured by specific assets (typically receivables or inventory) an made on the basis of a borrowing formula (borrowing base) that reflects a percentage of the value of such assets.

schemeValue.name: Acquisition
schemeValue.paragraph: A specific type of loan that typically cannot be reborrowed. Funds can be drawn down from the line of credit only for a specific period of time and only to purchase specified assets.

schemeValue.name: Add-On
schemeValue.paragraph: An increase to an existing facility.

schemeValue.name: Advance
schemeValue.paragraph: An individual borrowing under a credit facility.

schemeValue.name: BankersAcceptance
schemeValue.paragraph: A promised future payment, or time draft, which is accepted and guaranteed by a bank and drawn on a deposit at the bank. The banker's acceptance specifies the amount of money, the date, and the person to which the payment is due. After acceptance, the draft becomes an unconditional liability of the bank. But the holder of the draft can sell (exchange) it for cash at a discount to a buyer who is willing to wait until the maturity date for the funds in the deposit.

schemeValue.name: Bridge
schemeValue.paragraph: A Credit Facility pursuant to which Lenders make Bridge Loans which are short-term loans (generally maturing in one year) that typically (although not always) are not intended to be funded. The purpose of the Bridge Loan is to provide a bidder with a committed financing in the context of an action for a business in case the Notes offering contemplated as part of the acquisition financing cannot be consummated prior to the consumption of the acquisition (i.e., to "bridge" the gap in financing). Traditionally, Bridge Loans are used by Financial Buyers (Sponsors) in auction situations, but corporate buyers also sometimes use Bridge Loans to finance acquisitions.

schemeValue.name: Capex
schemeValue.paragraph: A facility whose loans are used to fund capital expenditures which are defined as any expenditure in respect of a capital asset of the borrower, i.e., an expenditure that does not flow through the borrower's income statement.

schemeValue.name: DIP
schemeValue.paragraph: Debtor-In-Possession (DIP Loan Facility: A credit agreement entered into by a borrower during the course of its Chapter 11 bankruptcy case, which is secured and has priority over existing debt and other claims.

schemeValue.name: Exit
schemeValue.paragraph: Financing that takes place when a debtor is ready to confirm a plan and exit Bankruptcy. It is through Exit Financing that the debtor is able to fund its plan of reorganization. In most, if not all, plans of reorganization, Exit Financing is required to be available before a debtor can reach the effective date for its plan.

schemeValue.name: Extended
schemeValue.paragraph: Credit Facility that is extended beyond its original maturity date. When all or a portion of the initial facilitiy remains and is not extended, the extended portion becomes a new facility.

schemeValue.name: Guarantee
schemeValue.paragraph: A Guarantor's agreement to purchase or otherwise become contingently liable for the debts or other obligations of another entity. With respect to a group of companies guarantees can be "upstream" (a subsidiary guaranteeing debt of its parent), "cross-stream" (a subsidiary guaranteeing debt of a "sister" company, where both are ultimately owned by the same parent) and "downstream" (a parent guaranteeing debt of a subsidiary).

schemeValue.name: Incremental
schemeValue.paragraph: A post-Closing addition to an existing Credit Facility on substantially the same terms as the existing Credit Facility, typically used to finance acquisitions, investments or even dividends. The existing Lenders do not precommit to provide the Incremental Facility, but do pre-approve the incremental leverage. At the time the Borrower desires to add on to the existing Credit Facility, it must seek new commitments from existing or new Lenders. Incremental Facility debt is additional Secured Debt that shares Collateral with the pre-existing First or Second Lien Debt.

schemeValue.name: Mezzanine
schemeValue.paragraph: An unsecured debt instrument with certain equity-like characteristics. The Mezzanine component of a capital structure is subordinate in right of payment to Senior Debt and carries a coupon similar to high yield bonds. Mezzanine debt is often issued at the holdco level. Mezzanine debt often has equity features, frequently referred to as equity kickers, which may take the form of warrants that permit the holder to purchase equity at a preset price, or conversion features upon certain events (such as change of control). The combination of the debt coupon and the equity kicker gives Mezzanine investors a higher return than high yield bonds.

schemeValue.name: Non-Extended
schemeValue.paragraph: Credit Facility that is not extended beyond its original maturity date.

schemeValue.name: PIK
schemeValue.paragraph: "Payment in Kind" interest is a form of payment where the interest owed by the borrower is added to the principal amount owed to a lender. A separate PIK facility is comprised of this interest.

schemeValue.name: PIKToggle
schemeValue.paragraph: An interest rate feature that gives the Borrower the option to pay all, half or none of the interest for any period (generally during a non-call period) in kind. Typically, an interest rate step up will apply to any portion of interest that is paid in kind. PIK Toggles are attractive to Borrowers because of the ability to "toggle" out of cash interest payments in times of a liquidity crunch - meaning if the Borrower is short on cash, it can stop making cash interest payments and just let the interest PIK.

schemeValue.name: Synthetic
schemeValue.paragraph: Typically refers to letters of credit.

schemeValue.name: GOFO
schemeValue.paragraph: Gold Forward Rate.
