schemeValue.name: AsAgreedInWriting
schemeValue.paragraph: As agreed in writing by the parties.

schemeValue.name: LinearZeroYield
schemeValue.paragraph: Linear Interpolation applicable.

schemeValue.name: None
schemeValue.paragraph: No Interpolation applicable.

schemeValue.name: Documentary
schemeValue.paragraph: Letter of credit extended on documents of title or other legal documents.

schemeValue.name: Financial
schemeValue.paragraph: A Letter of Credit that provides a means of facilitating payments between parties in the normal course of business, supporting the shipment of and payment for goods.

schemeValue.name: Performance
schemeValue.paragraph: A Letter of Credit that supports the performance of non-financial obligations.

schemeValue.name: Commercial
schemeValue.paragraph: A Letter of Credit that provides a means of facilitating payments between parties in the normal course of business, supporting the shipment of and payment for goods. Commercial Letters of Credit are intended to be drawn on.

schemeValue.name: Standby
schemeValue.paragraph: A Letter of Credit the purpose of which is to provide credit support only in the event of a performance default by the account party (i.e. the borrower) or some other contingent event. The Standby Letter of Credit supports an obligation to make a payment to the beneficiary.

schemeValue.name: Synthetic
schemeValue.paragraph: A Letter of Credit under a facility that has been "pre-funded" by the lenders on the closing date (with the proceeds from such funding typically being deposited in a cash collateral account) rather than being funded on a later date upon the occurrence of a contingent event requiring payment under the L/C to the third party.

schemeValue.name: CreditSupportAnnex
schemeValue.paragraph: An Credit Support Annex.

schemeValue.name: MasterAgreement
schemeValue.paragraph: A Master Agreement.

schemeValue.name: StandardCreditSupportAnnex
schemeValue.paragraph: An Standard Credit Support Annex.

schemeValue.name: AFB
schemeValue.paragraph: Association Francaise des Banques.

schemeValue.name: ISDA
schemeValue.paragraph: International Swaps and Derivatives Association, Inc.

schemeValue.name: EnglishLaw
schemeValue.paragraph: English Law.

schemeValue.name: JapaneseLaw
schemeValue.paragraph: Japanese Law.

schemeValue.name: NewYorkLaw
schemeValue.paragraph: New York Law.

schemeValue.name: AffiliateOfAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: The loan purchaser controls, is controlled by or is under common control with the agent bank.

schemeValue.name: AffiliateOfExistingLender
schemeValue.paragraph: The loan purchaser controls, is controlled by or is under common control with a current lender.

schemeValue.name: ApprovedFund
schemeValue.paragraph: As used in the LSTA's Model Credit Agreement Provisions, any fund that is (a) administered or managed by a lender, (b) an affiliate of a lender or (c) an entity or an affiliate of an entity that administers or manages a lender.

schemeValue.name: ExistingLender
schemeValue.paragraph: An entity that is currently extending credit to a borrower or borrowers pursuant to the terms of the credit agreement governing a credit facility.

schemeValue.name: AllocatedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of the block trade that originated this trade in an allocation process. This is used by each one of the allocated trades to reference the block trade.

schemeValue.name: AllocatedTo
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of an allocated trade. This is used by the block trade to reference the trades resulting from the allocaiton process.

schemeValue.name: BackToBackFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that this one was created to emulate the economic characteristics of. This trade is in a different legal entity from the original trade. Typically used as part of a prime brokerage, agency, or similar operation. Distinguished from MirroredFrom, in which the mirror trade is booked into the same legal entity (but a different book) than the original trade.

schemeValue.name: BackToBackTo
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that was created to emulate the economic characteristics of this trade. This trade is in a different legal entity from the original trade. Typically used as part of a prime brokerage, agency, or similar operation. Distinguished from MirroredTo, in which the mirror trade is booked into the same legal entity (but a different book) than the original trade.

schemeValue.name: ClearedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The ID of the trade that was submitted for clearing, from which this trade was created. Equivalent to "originating trade" for a clearing operation.

schemeValue.name: ClearedTo
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a resulting trade (beta or gamma trade) that resulted from this trade during a clearing operation. Equivalent to "resulting trade".

schemeValue.name: CompressedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that belonged to a portfolio that this one was created to emulate the characteristics of, so that portfolio trades could be cancelled to simplify processing. Typically in compression multiple trades that are similar but not necessarily identical are emulated by a single trade or smaller number of trades that combine the risk profile of the original trade.

schemeValue.name: CompressedTo
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that emulate the characteristics of a portfolio of trades, so that portfolio trades could be cancelled to simplify processing. Typically in compression multiple trades that are similar but not necessarily identical are emulated by a single trade or smaller number of trades that combine the risk profile of the original trade.

schemeValue.name: ExercisedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The ID of an option trade that was exercised to create this trade.

schemeValue.name: ExercisedInto
schemeValue.paragraph: The ID of a trade that was created from this option trade when the option was exercise physically.

schemeValue.name: MirroredFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that this one was created to emulate the economic characteristics of. This trade is in then legal entity as the original trade. Typically used as part of a prime brokerage, agency, or similar operation. Distinguished from BackToBackFrom, in which the back-to-back trade is booked into a different legal entity from the original trade.

schemeValue.name: MirroredTo
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that was created to emulate the economic characteristics of this trade. This trade is in the same legal entity as the original trade. Typically used as part of a prime brokerage, agency, or similar operation. Distinguished from BackToBackTo, in which the back-to-back trade is booked into a different legal entity from the original trade.

schemeValue.name: NettedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that was combined with others more or less identical in characteristics, except possibly size and/or direction, into this trade. This is typically done to simplify processing.

schemeValue.name: NettedTo
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade id of a trade that resulted from combinining this trade with others that were more or less identical in characteristics, except possibly size and/or direction, to simplify processing.

schemeValue.name: NovatedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: In a novation process, the ID of the original trade that was novated to create this one.

schemeValue.name: NovatedTo
schemeValue.paragraph: In a novation process, the ID of the new trade that was created based on this one.

schemeValue.name: RebookedFrom
schemeValue.paragraph: In a cancellation-rebooking process, the previous (cancelled) version of the trade.

schemeValue.name: RebookedTo
schemeValue.paragraph: In a cancellation-rebooking process, the replacement (rebooked) version of the trade.

schemeValue.name: StructureComponent
schemeValue.paragraph: Where a single, structured trade which is traded with a counterparty is decomposed into constituent trades for internal risk management, this represents the ID of the consitutent trade to which this structured trade is decomposed.

schemeValue.name: StructureMember
schemeValue.paragraph: Where a series of trades are grouped into a structure for trading purposes, this represents the trade ID of another member of that structure.

schemeValue.name: StructureParent
schemeValue.paragraph: Where a single, structured trade which is traded with a counterparty is decomposed into constituent trades for internal risk management, this represents the ID of the structured trade to which this consistuent trade belongs.

schemeValue.name: BridgeLoan
schemeValue.paragraph: Bridge loan.

schemeValue.name: DelayedDrawTerm
schemeValue.paragraph: Delayed Draw Term.

schemeValue.name: LetterOfCredit
schemeValue.paragraph: Letter of credit, i.e. commitment by a bank or syndicate to provide a certain amount of funding.

schemeValue.name: Revolver
schemeValue.paragraph: Revolving loan.

schemeValue.name: SwinglineFunding
schemeValue.paragraph: Swingline funding, which refers to the portion of revolving loan facility that can be funded without advance notice. Sometimes, the swingline is traded separately from the rest of the loan facility.

schemeValue.name: Term
schemeValue.paragraph: Term loan.

schemeValue.name: TradeClaim
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade claim, i.e. claim on assets that result from a restructuring or bankruptcy.

schemeValue.paragraph: Kiribati Dollar.

schemeValue.paragraph: TVD.

schemeValue.name: MCF
schemeValue.paragraph: Monegasque franc. Historical currency code.

schemeValue.name: SML
schemeValue.paragraph: Sammarinese lira. Hhistorical currency code.

schemeValue.name: VAL
schemeValue.paragraph: Vatican lira. Historical currency code.

schemeValue.name: AgentFreeze
schemeValue.paragraph: Period during which, due to servicing obligations by the Agent, no settlement of trades can occur.

schemeValue.name: CLOBlackout
schemeValue.paragraph: Period during which, due to the formation and funding of a CLO entity lender, no settlement of trades can occur.

schemeValue.name: Call
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to buy an asset on predefined terms. The asset may in turn be based on other assets, for example a spread on prices.

schemeValue.name: Cap
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments when a rate exceeds a specified level

schemeValue.name: Chooser
schemeValue.paragraph: An option in which the option holder has the right to choose which type of option (e.g. a put or a call) the option will be.

schemeValue.name: Collar
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments based on the amount by which a rate or a price exceeds a specified level coupled with the obligation to make payments if the rate or price is under a (possibly different) level.

schemeValue.name: Floor
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments when a rate is under a specified level

schemeValue.name: Other
schemeValue.paragraph: An option type not otherwise categorizable

schemeValue.name: PayFixed
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to enter a swap transaction in which the option holder would pay a fixed rate or price. (Also known as a "Payer" swaption, or "RTP"=Right to Pay swaption.)

schemeValue.name: Put
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to sell an asset on predefined terms. The asset may in turn be based on other assets, for example a spread on prices.

schemeValue.name: ReceiveFixed
schemeValue.paragraph: The right but not the obligation to enter a swap transaction in which the option holder would receive a fixed rate or price. (Also known as a "Receiver" swaption, or "RTR"=Right to Receive swaption.)

schemeValue.name: Straddle
schemeValue.paragraph: The right to receive payments based on the amount by which a rate or a price exceeds a specified level or is under a (possibly different) level

schemeValue.name: MSP
schemeValue.paragraph: A significant participant in the swaps market, for example as defined by the Dodd-Frank Act.

schemeValue.name: NaturalPerson
schemeValue.paragraph: A human being.

schemeValue.name: non-SD/MSP
schemeValue.paragraph: A firm that is neither a swap dealer nor a major swaps participant under the Dodd-Frank Act.

schemeValue.name: SD
schemeValue.paragraph: Registered swap dealer.

schemeValue.name: Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from an allocation.

schemeValue.name: Amendment
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from an amendment. (Normally an amendment should be represented directly as an amendment event; this originating event reason is provided to cover the case where a system must cancel and rebook the trade as a result of the amendment.)

schemeValue.name: BlockTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade that is allocated subsequently.

schemeValue.name: Clearing
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade is the result of a clearing operation.

schemeValue.name: ClearingDefaultTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the trade was put on as the result of the reassignment of a trade formerly held by a now defaulted clearing member firm.

schemeValue.name: CreditEvent
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a credit event.

schemeValue.name: Exercise
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from an exercise event.

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from netting.

schemeValue.name: Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a novation event (the terms transfer, assignment are also used in the industry).

schemeValue.name: PartialNovation
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a partial novation event (the terms transfer, assignment are also used in the industry).

schemeValue.name: PortfolioCompression
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from portfolio compression.

schemeValue.name: Porting
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade was created as a result of porting. ("Porting" is a type of novation in a cleared environment where the actual parties to the trade don't change, but one of the parties moves to a new clearing firm or account.)

schemeValue.name: StrategicRestructuring
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from strategic restructuring.

schemeValue.name: SuccessionEventRenaming
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a renaming succession event.

schemeValue.name: SuccessionEventReorganization
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade results from a reorganization succession event.

schemeValue.name: Trade
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the trade or trade package is the result of a trade transaction.

schemeValue.name: ACTX
schemeValue.paragraph: Agency cross transactions (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: ALGO
schemeValue.paragraph: Algorithmic transactions (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: AMND
schemeValue.paragraph: Amendments (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: BENC
schemeValue.paragraph: Benchmark (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: CANC
schemeValue.paragraph: Cancellations (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: DUPL
schemeValue.paragraph: Duplicative trade reports (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: ILQD
schemeValue.paragraph: Illiquid instrument (for non-equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: LRGS
schemeValue.paragraph: Post-trade large-in-scale transactions (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: NLIQ
schemeValue.paragraph: Negotiated transactions in liquid financial instruments (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: NPFT
schemeValue.paragraph: Non-price forming transactions (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: OILQ
schemeValue.paragraph: Negotiated transactions in illiquid financial instruments (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: PRIC
schemeValue.paragraph: Negotiated transactions subject to conditions other than the current market price (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: RFPT
schemeValue.paragraph: Reference price transactions (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: RPRI
schemeValue.paragraph: Transactions which have received price improvement (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: SDIV
schemeValue.paragraph: Special dividend (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: SIZE
schemeValue.paragraph: Above specified size transaction (For all instruments).

schemeValue.name: TNCP
schemeValue.paragraph: Transactions not contributing to the price discovery process for the purposes of Article 23 of Regulation (EU) No 600/2014 (For equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: TPAC
schemeValue.paragraph: Package transaction (For non-equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: XFPH
schemeValue.paragraph: Exchange for Physical transaction (For non-equity instruments).

schemeValue.name: Butterfly
schemeValue.paragraph: A strategy in which a firm either pays or receives fixed for intermediate term (the "body"), and does the opposite (receives or pays fixed) for a short and a long term (the "wings").

schemeValue.name: CalendarRoll
schemeValue.paragraph: A strategy in which a swap is used to Roll from one IMM date into another IMM swap.

schemeValue.name: CalendarSpread
schemeValue.paragraph: A strategy in which 2 trades on different dates are done at the same time, e.g., Sept vs June.

schemeValue.name: Custom
schemeValue.paragraph: A package created for a particular client need e.g., portfolioCompression, termination.

schemeValue.name: IndexRoll
schemeValue.paragraph: A strategy in which a firms buys new version of index and sells and old version of the same index.

schemeValue.name: OneCancelsOthers
schemeValue.paragraph: A package in which only a maximum of one of the components will be executed (used for credit limit checking/orders).

schemeValue.name: SwapSpread
schemeValue.paragraph: A strategy in which a firm either buys a treasury and enters a payer swap, or sells treasury and enters a receiver swap.

schemeValue.name: Switch
schemeValue.paragraph: A strategy in which a firm either pays or receives fixed for some term versus the opposite (receives or pays fixed) for different term. Typically the second term starts at the completion of the first.

schemeValue.name: JointAndSeveralLiability
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates that the group of parties are jointly and severally liable.

schemeValue.name: Affiliated
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates whether the transaction is between two affiliated entities. It is referred to as Inter-affiliate under the Canadian CSA reporting regime.

schemeValue.name: Inter-Dealer
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the transaction is between two dealers.

schemeValue.name: Intragroup
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates whether the contract was concluded as an intra-group transaction, defined in Article 3, 4(2), 11(6) to 11(10) of EMIR.

schemeValue.name: Accountant
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization responsible for preparing the accounting for the trade.

schemeValue.name: AllocationAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization responsible for supplying the allocations for a trade to be allocated to multiple accounts/organizations.

schemeValue.name: ArrangingBroker
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that arranged the trade, i.e. brought together the counterparties. Synonyms/Alternatives: Inter-dealer broker, agent.

schemeValue.name: Beneficiary
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that suffers the economic benefit of the trade. The beneficiary may be distinct from the principal/counterparty - an example occurs when a hedge fund trades via a prime broker; in this case the principal is the prime broker, but the beneficiary is the hedge fund. This can be represented as a payer/receiver account in the name of the hedge fund, but it is also possible to add the party role of "Beneficiary" at the partyTradeInformation level.

schemeValue.name: BookingParty
schemeValue.paragraph: The entity for which the organization supporting the trade's processing has booked/recorded the trade. This is used in non-reporting workflows situations in which the trade doesn't need to be reported but a firm still wants to specify their own side.

schemeValue.name: Buyer
schemeValue.paragraph: Acquirer of the legal title to the financial instrument. In the case of an option, the buyer is the holder of the option. In the case of a swap or forward, the buyer will be determined by industry best practice. This does not refer to an investor or investment manager or other organization on what is typically called the "Buy side"; for that, see the "Client" role. Corresponds to "Buyer" as defined in certain regulations such as ESMA MiFID II/MIFIR RTS 22 field 9.

schemeValue.name: BuyerDecisionMaker
schemeValue.paragraph: The party or person who, having legal authority to act on behalf of the trade counterparty acting as Buyer as defined in this coding scheme, made the decision to acquire the financial instrument. Corresponds to "buyer decision maker" as defined in ESMA's MIFIR RTS 23 report. This does not refer to the decision maker for what is traditionally called the "Buy side"; for that, see the "Client Decision Maker" role.

schemeValue.name: ClearingClient
schemeValue.paragraph: An organization that clears trades through a clearing house, via a clearing broker (member of the clearing house) who acts as an agent on its behalf. The term "client" refers to the organization's role in the clearing process in relation to its clearing broker, and not whether it is a price maker or taker in the execution process.

schemeValue.name: ClearingExceptionParty
schemeValue.paragraph: A party to the trade that claims a clearing exception, such as an end-user exception under Dodd-Frank Act provisions.

schemeValue.name: ClearingFirm
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that submits the trade to a clearing house on behalf of the principal. Synonyms/alternates: Futures Commission Merchant (FCM), Clearing Broker, Clearing Member Firm. Some implementations use "Clearing Broker" as synonym.

schemeValue.name: ClearingOrganization
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that acts as a central counterparty to clear a derivatives contract. This is used to represent the role of Central Counterparties (CCPs) or Derivative Clearing Organizations (DCOs). Sometimes called "ClearingService". Some implementations also use the term "Clearer".

schemeValue.name: Client
schemeValue.paragraph: Client as defined under ESMA MIFIR. This is generally the investor or other client of an investment firm, and is synonymous with the Beneficiary in many circumstances.

schemeValue.name: ClientDecisionMaker
schemeValue.paragraph: The party or person who, having legal authority to act on behalf of a trade counterparty, made the decision to acquire or sell the financial instrument.

schemeValue.name: ConfirmationPlatform
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization serving as a financial intermediary for the purposes of electronic confirmation or providing services for post-processing of transactional data.

schemeValue.name: ContractualParty
schemeValue.paragraph: A party to a contractual document. If the intended usage relates to the context of the trade lifecycle, more specific annotations have been defined which might be more appropriate.

schemeValue.name: Counterparty
schemeValue.paragraph: An economic counterparty to the trade. Synonym: principal.

schemeValue.name: CounterPartyAffiliate
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization offiially attached to the counterparty. e.g. partner, branch, subsidiary.

schemeValue.name: CounterPartyUltimateParent
schemeValue.paragraph: The topmost entity or organization, within the corporate hierarchy, responsible for the reporting party.

schemeValue.name: CreditSupportProvider
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that enhances the credit of another organization (similar to guarantor, but may not fully guarantee the obligation).

schemeValue.name: Custodian
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that maintains custody of the asset represented by the trade on behalf of the owner/principal.

schemeValue.name: DataSubmitter
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity submitting the transaction report to the competent authority.

schemeValue.name: DisputingParty
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that is disputing the trade or transaction.

schemeValue.name: DocumentRepository
schemeValue.paragraph: A marketplace organization which purpose is to maintain document records. If the intended usage relates to the context of the trade lifecycle, more specific annotations have been defined which might be more appropriate.

schemeValue.name: ExecutingBroker
schemeValue.paragraph: The (generally sell-side) organization that executed the trade; the price-making party.

schemeValue.name: ExecutingEntity
schemeValue.paragraph: Entity executing the transaction. If the transaction is executed directly by the reporting party, it will be the reporting party. If it is executed by an execution agent or an affiliated party on behalf of the reporting party, it will be that affiliate or agent.

schemeValue.name: ExecutionAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: The (generally buy-side) organization that acts to execute trades on behalf of an investor. Typically this is an investment manager or asset manager, and also makes the investment decisions for the investor. If required, a separate InvestmentDecision role can be specified to distinguish that the party making the investment decision is different.

schemeValue.name: ExecutionFacility
schemeValue.paragraph: The facility, exchange, or market where the trade was executed. Synonym: Swap Execution Facility, Designated Contract Market, Execution Venue.

schemeValue.name: Guarantor
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization that backs (guarantees) the credit risk of the trade.

schemeValue.name: OrderTransmitter
schemeValue.paragraph: The entity transmitting the order to the reporting firm. Synonym: Transmitting Firm.

schemeValue.name: PrimeBroker
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that takes on or took on the credit risk for this trade by stepping in between the two economic parties (without a central counterparty clearing mechanism).

schemeValue.name: PriorTradeRepository
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade repository at which the trade was reported previous to the current trade repository.

schemeValue.name: PublicationVenue
schemeValue.paragraph: The reporting service (whether trade repository, market data service, or exchange/facility/venue data distribution service) that published the report of this trade.

schemeValue.name: ReportingParty
schemeValue.paragraph: The party with the regulatory responsibility to report this trade.

schemeValue.name: ReportingPartyAffiliate
schemeValue.paragraph: Organization offiially attached to the reporting party e.g. partner, branch, subsidiary.

schemeValue.name: ReportingPartyUltimateParent
schemeValue.paragraph: The topmost entity or organization, within the corporate hierarchy, responsible for the reporting party.

schemeValue.name: Seller
schemeValue.paragraph: A counterparty in a trade, which performs in one of the following capacities: 1) it transfers or agrees to transfer in the future an instrument or title to that instrument in exchange for payment, 2) it writes a derivatives instrument such as an option or a swap in which it provides risk protection to the buyer. This does not refer to the broker/dealer or other organization on what is typically called the "Sell side"; for that, see the "Executing Broker" role. Corresponds to "Seller" as defined in certain regulations such as ESMA MiFID II/MIFIR RTS 22 field 16.

schemeValue.name: SellerDecisionMaker
schemeValue.paragraph: The party or person who, having legal authority to act on behalf of the trade counterparty acting as Seller as defined in this coding scheme, made the decision to sell the financial instrument. Corresponds to "seller decision maker" as defined in ESMA's MIFIR RTS 23 report. This does not refer to the decision maker for what is traditionally called the "Sell side"; for that, see the "Trader" person role.

schemeValue.name: SettlementAgent
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that makes or receives payments on behalf of the given principal party.

schemeValue.name: TradeRepository
schemeValue.paragraph: An organization that maintains records of the trade for regulatory reporting purposes.

schemeValue.name: TradeSource
schemeValue.paragraph: The organization that originally supplied the record of the trade. In the context of regulatory reporting, it is the submitter of the trade record to a regulator or TR.

schemeValue.name: TradingManager
schemeValue.paragraph: The entity responsible for managing the assets/investments of this party. Synonnym: Asset Manager, Investment Manager, Trading Advisory.

schemeValue.name: TradingPartner
schemeValue.paragraph: An entity with which this party trades from time to time, ie. with which it acts as a counterparty on some transactions. This role is used for static reference data, not individual transactions.

schemeValue.name: AllPositions
schemeValue.paragraph: All Positions.

schemeValue.name: SomePositions
schemeValue.paragraph: Some Positions.

schemeValue.name: Broker
schemeValue.paragraph: The person who arranged with a client to execute the trade.

schemeValue.name: Buyer
schemeValue.paragraph: Acquirer of the legal title to the financial instrument.

schemeValue.name: DecisionMaker
schemeValue.paragraph: The party or person with legal responsibility for authorization of the execution of the transaction.

schemeValue.name: ExecutionWithinFirm
schemeValue.paragraph: Person within the firm who is responsible for execution of the transaction.

schemeValue.name: InvestmentDecisionMaker
schemeValue.paragraph: Person who is responsible for making the investment decision.

schemeValue.name: Seller
schemeValue.paragraph: Seller of the legal title to the financial instrument.

schemeValue.name: Trader
schemeValue.paragraph: The person who executed the trade.

schemeValue.name: Absolute
schemeValue.paragraph: The perturbation is absolute, ie. it is ADDED to the original value.

schemeValue.name: Relative
schemeValue.paragraph: The perturbation is relative, ie. it is MULTIPLIED by the original value.

schemeValue.name: AssignmentBuy
schemeValue.paragraph: A purchase, by assignment (change in lender of record), of a portion of a facility within the secondary markets.

schemeValue.name: AssignmentSell
schemeValue.paragraph: A sale, by assignment (change in lender of record), of a portion of a facility within the secondary markets.

schemeValue.name: CommitmentDecrease
schemeValue.paragraph: A decrease in the commitment level against a particular facility.

schemeValue.name: CommitmentIncrease
schemeValue.paragraph: An increase in the commitment level against a particular facility.

schemeValue.name: Paydown
schemeValue.paragraph: The repayment of a loan within a given facility, resulting in a decrease of the commitment level of the facility.

schemeValue.name: PIKInterestCapitalization
schemeValue.paragraph: The increase of a loan within a facility, due to the borrower requiring further credit in order to cover interest costs.

schemeValue.name: Alleged
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding position was found in "your" submitted set.

schemeValue.name: Matched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same position information within matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Mismatched
schemeValue.paragraph: Both sides have the same position, but there are differences greater than the acceptable tolerance in the matching policies.

schemeValue.name: Unmatched
schemeValue.paragraph: No corresponding position was found in "the other party's" submitted set.

schemeValue.name: Amendment
schemeValue.paragraph: An existing trade was changed via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Cancellation
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade was removed for reasons other than a negotiated agreement (e.g. reported in error).

schemeValue.name: Correction
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade details were adjusted to correct a prior error.

schemeValue.name: Exercise
schemeValue.paragraph: An option was invoked and therefore the original option is no longer in effect.

schemeValue.name: Increase
schemeValue.paragraph: A trade's notional size was increased via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Netting
schemeValue.paragraph: Similar trades were combined for processing simplicity.

schemeValue.name: NewTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Newly created trade.

schemeValue.name: NonNegotiatedChange
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade details were adjusted for other reasons, e.g. corporate action.

schemeValue.name: Novation
schemeValue.paragraph: An existing trade was transferred to a new counterparty via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: Termination
schemeValue.paragraph: An existing trade was exited early via a negotiated agreement.

schemeValue.name: MarketMaker
schemeValue.paragraph: Market Maker Role.

schemeValue.name: PriceTaker
schemeValue.paragraph: Price Taker Role.

schemeValue.name: Allowances
schemeValue.paragraph: Environmental allowance certificates.

schemeValue.name: Amount
schemeValue.paragraph: A numerical amount (typically a currency amount), expressed as a decimal value.

schemeValue.name: BasisPoints
schemeValue.paragraph: A value expressed in terms of one hundredths of a percent, i.e. 5 means 5 basis points (bp) or 0.05%.

schemeValue.name: BasisPointValue
schemeValue.paragraph: The value (expressed in currency units) per basis point change in the underlying rate. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to interest rate chages ("IR delta" risk, "rho" risk).

schemeValue.name: BasisPointValuePerBasisPoint
schemeValue.paragraph: The Basis Point Value (BPV) (expressed in currency units per basis point) per basis point change in the underlying rate. Typically used for expressing second order sensitivity to interest rate changes (IR "gamma" risk, "convexity").

schemeValue.name: BBL
schemeValue.paragraph: Barrel.

schemeValue.name: BCF
schemeValue.paragraph: Billion cubic feet.

schemeValue.name: BSH
schemeValue.paragraph: Bushel - When associated with a specific commodity, e.g. Barley, implies standard unit of weight, in this case 48 lb or 21.7725 kg.

schemeValue.name: BTU
schemeValue.paragraph: British Thermal Unit.

schemeValue.name: CDD
schemeValue.paragraph: Cooling Degree Day.

schemeValue.name: CPD
schemeValue.paragraph: Critical Precipitation Day.

schemeValue.name: CWT
schemeValue.paragraph: Short hundredweight (100 lb).

schemeValue.name: dag
schemeValue.paragraph: 10 grams. Used in precious metals contracts (e.g MCX).

schemeValue.name: Day
schemeValue.paragraph: Day (commonly used in Time Charter trades).

schemeValue.name: Discount
schemeValue.paragraph: A discount factor expressed as a decimal, e.g. 0.95.

schemeValue.name: dmtu
schemeValue.paragraph: Dry Metric Ton (Tonne) Units - Consists of a metric ton of mass excluding moisture.

schemeValue.name: DTH
schemeValue.paragraph: Dekatherm.

schemeValue.name: ExchangeRate
schemeValue.paragraph: A dimensionless conversion rate, e.g. 1.2. Typically used for FX.

schemeValue.name: FEU
schemeValue.paragraph: 40 ft. Equivalent Unit container.

schemeValue.name: GAL
schemeValue.paragraph: Gallon.

schemeValue.name: GJ
schemeValue.paragraph: Gigajoule.

schemeValue.name: GW
schemeValue.paragraph: Gigawatt.

schemeValue.name: GWh
schemeValue.paragraph: Gigawatt-hour.

schemeValue.name: HDD
schemeValue.paragraph: Heating Degree Day.

schemeValue.name: hL
schemeValue.paragraph: Hectolitre.

schemeValue.name: IndexUnits
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in index units.

schemeValue.name: Ingot
schemeValue.paragraph: Ingot.

schemeValue.name: IRFuturesPrice
schemeValue.paragraph: A IMM futures style price, e.g. 9750 is equivalent to 2.5%.

schemeValue.name: KG
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilogram.

schemeValue.name: kL
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilolitre.

schemeValue.name: KW
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilowatt.

schemeValue.name: KWh
schemeValue.paragraph: Kilowatt-hour.

schemeValue.name: L
schemeValue.paragraph: Litre.

schemeValue.name: LB
schemeValue.paragraph: Pound.

schemeValue.name: LogNormalVolatility
schemeValue.paragraph: A log normal volatility, expressed in %/month, where the percentage is represented as a decimal. For example, 0.15 means a log-normal volatility of 15% per month.

schemeValue.name: MB
schemeValue.paragraph: Thousand Barrels (BBL).

schemeValue.name: MBF
schemeValue.paragraph: Thousand board feet. Used in contracts on forestry underlyers.

schemeValue.name: MJ
schemeValue.paragraph: Megajoule.

schemeValue.name: MMBF
schemeValue.paragraph: Million board feet. Used in contracts on forestry underlyers.

schemeValue.name: MMBTU
schemeValue.paragraph: Million British Thermal Units.

schemeValue.name: msf
schemeValue.paragraph: Thousand (1,000) square feet.

schemeValue.name: MT
schemeValue.paragraph: Metric Tonne.

schemeValue.name: MW
schemeValue.paragraph: Megawatt.

schemeValue.name: MWh
schemeValue.paragraph: Megawatt-hour.

schemeValue.name: ozt
schemeValue.paragraph: Troy Ounce.

schemeValue.name: ParValueDecimal
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in percentage of face value as a decimal, e.g. 101.5.

schemeValue.name: ParValueFraction
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in percentage of face value with fractions, e.g. 101 3/8. Normally used for quoting bonds.

schemeValue.name: Percentage
schemeValue.paragraph: A value expressed in percentage units i.e. 5 means 5%.

schemeValue.name: Price
schemeValue.paragraph: A price, expressed in currency units.

schemeValue.name: Rate
schemeValue.paragraph: A yield (typically an interest rate) expressed as a decimal. I.e. 0.05 means 5%.

schemeValue.name: Shares
schemeValue.paragraph: The number of units of stock. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to equity prices (equity "delta" risk).

schemeValue.name: Spread
schemeValue.paragraph: A difference in rates or prices expressed as a decimal. I.e. 0.05 means 5%.

schemeValue.name: st
schemeValue.paragraph: Short Ton.

schemeValue.name: st
schemeValue.paragraph: Short Ton.

schemeValue.name: t
schemeValue.paragraph: (Long) Ton.

schemeValue.name: TEU
schemeValue.paragraph: 20 ft. Equivalent Unit container.

schemeValue.name: Therm
schemeValue.paragraph: Therm.

schemeValue.name: UpfrontPoints
schemeValue.paragraph: A difference in rates (typically FX rates) expressed as a decimal value.

schemeValue.name: ValuePerDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The value (expressed in currency units) for a one day change in a valuation date. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to the passage of time ("theta" risk, "carry", etc.).

schemeValue.name: ValuePerPercent
schemeValue.paragraph: The value (expressed in currency units) per percent change in the underlying rate. Typically used for expressing sensitivity to volatility changes ("vega" risk).

schemeValue.name: Allocation
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade was created as an allocation of a previously traded contract, and thus does not reflect market activity.

schemeValue.name: ClearingDefaultTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade was triggered as a result of a clearing member firm default, and therefore may not reflect market price.

schemeValue.name: ClearingForcedTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade was required by a clearing service/CCP/DCO, e.g. as a result of its process to determine transaction pricing from its clearing members, and therefore may not reflect market price.

schemeValue.name: CrossBorder
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is not eligible for price reporting because (i) neither the direct nor indirect counterparty on either side is a US Person (ii) the SBS was neither executed on a platform nor accepted for clearing by a clearing agency, either of which has its principal place of business in the US (iii) the SBS was not effected by or through a registered broker-dealer (including a SBS SEF) and (iv) neither direct counterparty is a SBS dealing entity which has used its personnel or the personnel of an agent located in a US branch or office to arrange, negotiate or execute the SBS.

schemeValue.name: ForcedTrading
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade was forced to be executed for operational or risk reason and therefore does accurately reflect market prices.

schemeValue.name: HistoricTrade
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade was executed prior to the enactment of the reporting legislation or regulation, and therefore is not eligible for price disclosure.

schemeValue.name: Inter-Affiliate
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade was done between affiliated parties and the price may not accurately reflect market price.

schemeValue.name: NettingOrCompression
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade was created as a result of netting or compression. Applies for cleared SBS. (For a trade resulting from a clearing compression cycle, the code (along with the clearing flag) clarifies why the trade was not publicly disseminated.)

schemeValue.name: PackageOrBespoke
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade is bespoke or part of a package so the price or individual price components cannot be accurately determined.

schemeValue.name: PriceReportingExemptOther
schemeValue.paragraph: The trade is exempt for price disclosure for reasons not otherwise identified.

schemeValue.name: PrimeBrokerage
schemeValue.paragraph: Trade was entered into as part of an arrangement with a prime broker.

schemeValue.name: AssetPrices
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of the prices of collection of assets (in any asset class).

schemeValue.name: CreditCurve
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of credit pricing at different maturities.

schemeValue.name: FXForecastCurve
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of forecast FX rates at different maturities.

schemeValue.name: Time
schemeValue.paragraph: The valuation date or other time input.

schemeValue.name: VolatilityMatrix
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of the volatlity of an asset (in any asset class).

schemeValue.name: YieldCurve
schemeValue.paragraph: A representation of the interest rates (yields) at different maturities.

schemeValue.name: BackwardInduction
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates a Backward Induction method used to evaluate the price of an asset. Backward induction is the process of reasoning backwards in time, from the end of a problem or situation, to determine a sequence of optimal actions.

schemeValue.name: ClosedForm
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates a Closed Form model is used to evaluate the price of an asset. In mathematics, an expression is said to be a closed-form expression if it can be expressed analytically in terms of a finite number of certain "well-known" functions.

schemeValue.name: Intrinsic
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the market value as obtained by forecasting cash flows and discounting them to the present using a risk free rate of interest, without requiring probabilistic assumptions or models.

schemeValue.name: Model
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates the value is calculated based on an internal pricing model (e.g. Mark to Model).

schemeValue.name: MonteCarlo
schemeValue.paragraph: Indicates a Monte Carlo method used to evaluate the price of an asset. The Method encompasses any technique of statistical sampling employed to approximate solutions to quantitative problems.

schemeValue.name: 0.1-Percent
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.

schemeValue.name: 0.5-Percent
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.

schemeValue.name: 1.0-Percent
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.

schemeValue.name: 10-PPM
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 10-PPM-95-R
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 10-PPM-Premium-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 10-PPM-Regular-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 180-CST
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.

schemeValue.name: 3.5-Percent
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.

schemeValue.name: 380-CST
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.

schemeValue.name: 50-PPM
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Fuel Oil.
Applies to Oil Product Type Jet Fuel.
Applies to Oil Product Type Jet Fuel.

schemeValue.name: 87-M
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 87-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 87-Unleaded-ULS-30
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 92-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 93-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 95-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: 97-Unleaded
schemeValue.paragraph: Applies to Oil Product Type Gasoline.

schemeValue.name: AssetSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement where one leg mimics the return of the underlying asset. No transfer of asset takes place (sometimes the sale of the bond is included in the "asset swap construct").

schemeValue.name: BondOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that gives the buyer of the option the right to exercise it into the bond underlyer (or its cash equivalent) under specified conditions.

schemeValue.name: BulletPayment
schemeValue.paragraph: A single known payment between two parties.

schemeValue.name: BullionForward
schemeValue.paragraph: An agreement between two parties to exchange at some fixed future date a given quantity of bullion for a price defined today.

schemeValue.name: CapFloor
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that guarantees either a maximum (cap) or a minimum (floor) level of a variable inrerest rate reference.

schemeValue.name: CommodityOption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option on a commodity.

schemeValue.name: CommoditySwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which the payout to at least one counterparty is based on the price of a commodity or the level of a commodity index.

schemeValue.name: ConvertibleBondOption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option contract in which the underlying asset is a convertible bond.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultBasket
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on a basket of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultBasketTranche
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on a Tranche of an Index of a basket of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultIndex
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on an Index of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultIndexTranche
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other party following a credit event on a Tranche of an Index of credit entities.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultOption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option to buy protection (payer option) or sell protection (receiver option) as a credit default swap on a specific reference credit with a specific maturity.

schemeValue.name: CreditDefaultSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party pays a periodic fee in return for a contingent payment by the other other party following a credit event on a reference entity, a specific reference obligation or a basket of such reference names.

schemeValue.name: CrossCurrencySwap
schemeValue.paragraph: An interest rate swap agreement which interest streams are denominated in different currencies.

schemeValue.name: DividendSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: TBD

schemeValue.name: EquityForward
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract between two parties regarding the future value of the equity underlyer (or its cash equivalent).

schemeValue.name: EquityOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that gives the buyer of the option the right to exercise it into the equity underlyer (or its cash equivalent) under specified conditions.

schemeValue.name: FRA
schemeValue.paragraph: Forward Rate Agreement, corresponding to an agreement between parties regarding the level of a variable interest rate at a future date.

schemeValue.name: FxAccrualDigitalOption
schemeValue.paragraph: The holder of the option has the right to receive a fixed amount if spot at expiry is at or above (below) a pre-defined strike. The distinctive characteristic of this contract is that the Notional to be transacted at expiry is uncertain and depends on the amount of time that the underlying currency trades within a pre-set level, or levels (the "accrual barrier", or "barriers"). The total Notional is only known at the end of the accrual period, and this extra uncertainty can make an accrual option substantially cheaper than the comparable vanilla one.

schemeValue.name: FxAccrualForward
schemeValue.paragraph: A structured forward product consisting of a single forward or a strip of forwards. For each forward, a fixed proportion of Notional is accumulated for each occasion that spot fixes within pre-defined limits (the "accrual region") - the proportion determined by the number of fixings, which may occur every business day or with some other defined frequency. The Notional does not accumulate during any period where fixings fall outside the accrual region, but resumes accruing when spot returns within the limits. At expiry, the accrued Notional is bought at the pre-agreed hedge rate (the "strike" rate).

schemeValue.name: FxAccrualOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A financial contract between two parties (the buyer and the seller) that provides the buyer the right to buy a currency (or receive a payment) at expiry. The distinctive characteristic of this contract is that the Notional to be transacted at expiry is uncertain and depends on the amount of time that the underlying currency trades within a pre-set level, or levels (the "accrual barrier", or "barriers"). The total Notional is only known at the end of the accrual period, and this extra uncertainty can make an accrual option substantially cheaper than the comparable vanilla one.

schemeValue.name: FxForward
schemeValue.paragraph: An agreement between two parties regarding the future value of a currency exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: FxForwardVolatilityAgreement
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract on future levels of implied volatility. This contract can be cash settled or physically delivered.

schemeValue.name: FxNonDeliverableForward
schemeValue.paragraph: A cash-settled agreement between two parties regarding the future value of a currency exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: FxOption
schemeValue.paragraph: A contract that gives the buyer of the option the right to exercise it into the FX underlyer (or its cash equivalent) under specified conditions.

schemeValue.name: FxOptionStrategy
schemeValue.paragraph: A transaction consisting of several component transactions, at least one of which is a foreign exchange option transaction.

schemeValue.name: FxRangeAccrual
schemeValue.paragraph: The holder of the option has the right to receive a pre-defined amount for every day (or pre-defined frequency) that spot trades within the accrual range. The distinctive characteristic of this contract is that the Notional to be transacted at expiry is uncertain and depends on the amount of time that the underlying currency trades within a pre-set level, or levels (the "accrual barrier", or "barriers"). The total Notional is only known at the end of the accrual period, and this extra uncertainty can make an accrual option substantially cheaper than the comparable vanilla one.

schemeValue.name: FxSpot
schemeValue.paragraph: A foreign exchange deal that consists of a bilateral contract between a party delivering a certain amount of a currency against receiving a certain amount of another currency from a second counterparty, based on an agreed exchange rate.

schemeValue.name: FxSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A financial instrument that corresponds to the combination of an FX spot and an FX forward transactions.

schemeValue.name: FxTarget
schemeValue.paragraph: A structured forward product which consists of a strip of forwards. Each forward may be settled as an exchange of currencies or cash settled. At each settlement, the amount of gain that one party achieves is measured. The product has a target level of gain. Once the accumulated gain exceeds the target level, the product terminates/knocks out and there are no further settlements.

schemeValue.name: FxVarianceSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A Non-Deliverable Swap FX transaction that monitors the difference between the realized Variance and a fixed Variance rate of an underlying currency pair determined upon trade inception.

schemeValue.name: FxVolatilitySwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A Non-Deliverable Swap FX transaction that monitors the difference between the realized Volatility and a fixed Volatility rate of an underlying currency pair determined upon trade inception.

schemeValue.name: InflationSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement where one leg references an inflation index while the other one will typically reference a variable interest rate.

schemeValue.name: InterestRateSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement which consists in swapping interest rate streams, whatever the type of interest rate references that are being used (i.e. float vs. float swaps, also known as basis swaps, are included in this category).

schemeValue.name: InterestRateSwaption
schemeValue.paragraph: An option to enter into an interest rate swap.

schemeValue.name: Repo
schemeValue.paragraph: A Repurchase agreement in which one party (the Repo Seller) sells securities now, in return for cash from the other party (the Repo Buyer), and agrees to repurchase those securities (from the Repo Buyer) at a later time for the original cash amount and an additional sum.

schemeValue.name: TermDeposit
schemeValue.paragraph: The simple commoditized term deposit that is typically a trade with a tenor of 1-year or less with no interim interest payments.

schemeValue.name: TotalReturnSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A swap agreement in which one party transfers the economic performance of a reference asset to the other party, typically in the exchange of the financing cost of this asset.

schemeValue.name: VarianceSwap
schemeValue.paragraph: A financial derivative instrument whose price is a function of the variance of the price of the underlyer.

schemeValue.name: Equals
schemeValue.paragraph: The equals operator.

schemeValue.name: GreaterThan
schemeValue.paragraph: The greater than operator.

schemeValue.name: LessThan
schemeValue.paragraph: The less than operator.

schemeValue.name: NotEquals
schemeValue.paragraph: The not equals operator.

schemeValue.name: Close
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the end of day/market close.

schemeValue.name: EndOfDay
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the end of day value as computed during an end of day processing run.

schemeValue.name: High
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the highest value obtained during the day.

schemeValue.name: Low
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the lowest value obtained during the day.

schemeValue.name: Open
schemeValue.paragraph: The quotation represents the beginning of day/market open.

schemeValue.name: Pending
schemeValue.paragraph: Pricing information is pending and not currently available.
Default transport error code.
Transport unavailable.
Unknown recipient/destination.
Delivered to wrong recipient.
Timeout - message delivered past expiration.
This type of message not accepted on this transport.
Message generation problem (e.g. data conversion).
Message corrupted (e.g. CRC failure).
Message text doesn't match digital signature hash.
Default message processing error code.
Lexical problem - not well-formed XML.
Unsupported character set.
Empty or missing content.
Content too large.
System unavailable.
Message component text doesn't match digital signature hash.
Default validation error code.
Unknown or unsupported DTD/Schema.
Unsupported FpML version.
Invalid FpML message - message doesn't validate w.r.t. specified DTD/schema.
Validation failure - unsupported message type.
Validation failure - mandatory FpML rule (a rule we say must always be followed).
Validation failure - master agreement rule (a rule 2 parties agree to follow).
Validation failure - business policy (a rule that only the recipient has).
Validation failure - unsupported product/asset.
Signature required - message content must be signed.
Signature not accepted - problem with message signer (cert revoked, unacceptable principal, etc.).
Default business process error code.
Don't know - unrecognized trade.
Suitability - trade can't be done for client or dealer suitability reasons.
Credit - trade can't be done for credit reasons.
Not interested - recipient chooses not to respond.
Message arrived too late - e.g. trade no longer exists.
Message expired - message arrived on time, but a response was not generated in time.

schemeValue.name: EEA
schemeValue.paragraph: Countries that are within the European Economic Area as defined by ESMA.

schemeValue.name: NonEEA
schemeValue.paragraph: Countries that are not within the European Economic Area as defined by ESMA.
